physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Index case (III-2) presented with hypocalcemia, hyperphosphatemia, low serum PTH levels, and increased urinary calcium/creatinine ratio. The third son (III-3) also presented with hypocalcemia, hyperphosphatemia, low serum PTH, and a relatively increased urinary calcium/creatinine ratio.
Nephrocalcinosis and urolithiasis diagnosed in index case (III-2) after starting treatment.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Index case continues to have muscle cramps, especially in the neck, and headaches. Initially presented with headaches, decreased energy, muscle cramps, and stridor that have not improved.

physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Third son (III-3) showed recurrent episodes of severe flank pain; ultrasound revealed hydroureteronephrosis and a 3-mm renal stone.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Flank pain resolved after changing from calcium carbonate to calcium citrate replacement, with no further episodes of renal colic reported.
